author: Gino D'Acampo
method: Place the flour, baking powder and salt into a large bowl. Make a well in the middle of the flour mixture, add the eggs and whisk to combine. Gradually add the milk and whisk to make a thick batter. Stir in the chopped mango and leave to rest for five minutes. Heat the oil and butter in a frying pan and place spoonfuls of the batter into the pan. Fry for 2-3 minutes on each side, or until golden-brown. Remove from the pan and repeat with the remaining batter. To serve, place the pancakes onto a serving plate and drizzle with honey.
ingredients: 110g/4oz self-raising flour,  1 tsp baking powder,  pinch salt,  2 free-range eggs,  150ml/Â¼ pint milk,  4 mango slices, chopped,  dash vegetable oil,  1 tbsp butter,  honey, to serve
